row.entry: This module is used to crop, rotate and correct perspective of your image. It also includes many helpful guidelines that assist you using the tools.

sect4.title: Usage
sect4.para: Whenever the user interface of this module is in focus, you will see the full uncropped image overlayed with handles and guiding lines.

First off, select what aspect ratio you want and size the crop bounds by dragging border and corner handles. Use the button right to the aspect box, to swap between portrait and landscape of the cropping rectangle. You can move around the crop rectangle by holding down left mouse button and move around. When you are done and want to execute the crop, just give focus to another module. You can at any time change your crop area by just giving back focus to this module.

sect5.title: flip
sect5.para: This tool is used to flip the image on the horizontal,vertical or both axis.

sect5.title: angle
sect5.para: This is the rotation angle to correct, for example, a non-leveled horizon. You can either set a numerical value or use your mouse directly on the image. To use your mouse, right-click, hold it down and draw a line along the horizon; as soon as you release the mouse button the image is rotated so the line you drew matches the horizontal axis.

sect5.title: keystone
sect5.para: This tool is used to correct any perspective distortions in your image. Useful when you shoot an high building from ground, aiming upwards with camera with short focal length for example. To set the correction, select the type of correction you want to use :

limit the correction to horizontal lines
if you want to correct horizontal and vertical lines
then drag the 4 red circles to 4 angles of the building and apply the correction.

sect5.title: automatic cropping
sect5.para: Use this options to avoid black edges on the image borders. Useful when you rotate the image.

sect5.title: aspect
sect5.para: Here you can change what aspect ratio you want to have on the result, thus constraining the ability to drag and crop rectangle out of the aspect ratio of your choice. Many common numerical ratios are pre-defined. You also select any other ratio after opening the combobox and typing it in the form of "x:y". A few special aspect ratios deserve explanation:

row.entry: free forming the rectangle without any ratio restrictions
this option constrains the ratio to be equal to image ratio
this option constrains the ratio to be equal the golden number
this option constrains the ratio to be 1

sect5.title: guides
sect5.para: Many self-explaining guides are available to help you compose your image.
